messages.subject: Re: Science magazines for kids
messages.msgSnippet: Thanks Jill! Science At Home looks like the exact magazine I wanted. We have a Barnes & Noble nearby, so I guess we will be stopping there today to see if they
messages.messageBody:
Thanks Jill!

Science At Home looks like the exact magazine I wanted. We have a Barnes &
Noble nearby, so I guess we will be stopping there today to see if they
have it. :-)

Oh, I also just found the Scientific American Explorations magazine site
and it looks good too. Here it is:

http://www.explorations.org/index.html


I'll look for that one also at B&N. No wonder I can spend so much time and
money at bookstores! Thanks for getting the information for me.

Olivia






> Date: Sat, 29 Apr 2000 14:32:27 -0700 (PDT)
> From: J Salicos <elsas2@...>
>Subject: science mags. for Olivia
>
>> Olivia, I went to B&N today and found those Science
>Magazines for you. The first one is Science At Home.
>They have a web site but I could find no phone #.
>scienceathome.com
>the second mag is Scientific American Explorations
>phone # to order is 1-800-333-1199
>Scientific American does have a web site but I do not
>have the url. You could search it out though. Hope
>this helps. Both mags look great, lots of hands on.
>Good luck!
>Jill
